column5: Yesterday morning my good friend Scott (CANADIAN COPPER) had me up before the sun. It's just not right LOL. We lauched the Lowe around 6:30 and we were off to the river at the north end. A quick lesson on working the weeds for me. Scott missed a big one or should I say didn't check the knot and lost a 6Lb fish for sure, so he says, I think it was 12lbs by the splash.    The amount of boat rage was wild, I thought the rod was going to get it    He quickly regained himself and pulled in this one.    Not long after I got my first.   Scotty with another one.   Me again.   Scott again.   Scott looking at the small guy he caught.   One of the last of the day.    All in all it was a great day on the water, it was one of the best days I've had, thanks Scott. I learned a few things like how to duck out of the way of a Senko coming back at you fast when you miss the hook set and let the big guy settle a bit after he loses a big fish.  Thanks again Scott for the great morning.

WAS AN AWSOME OUTING INDEED!!! KNOWN CHRIS FOR A GOOD 5YRS OR SO NOW AND WAS GOOD TO FINALLY GET OUT  LOL MORN WAS A TAD SLOW BUT ONCE WE FOUND THE RIGHT PRESENTATION WE WERE ON FISH LEFT AND RIGHT!!! A FEW 5LBERS A COUPLE 4'S AND ALOT OF 3'S. WE WONT TALK ABOUT THE 6LBER I LOST!!! IM STILL IN ANGER MANAGEMENT OVER THAT ONE  LOL TX FOR THE OUTING BRO!!! JUST TOO BAD WE WERENT IN A TOUREMENT WITH THOSE FISH TODAY!!! WOULD OF BEEN IN THE TOP FOR SURE!!! TX AGAIN BRO AND LETS DO IT AGAIN!!! FIRST I GO TO HIT TIGHTLINES AND STOCK BACK UP !!! lol
Nice fish! We had to dodge a few of those flying senkos yesterday too. LOL
The mighty Nonquon River strikes again!
Great report and pics!!!  Good to see fellow OFNCer's getting out together!  Lokks like CC is gettin' hooked on those Green Trout!
Great report and pics Lowe Rider  Very nice looking buckets  Thanks for sharing Leechman
TX ALL!!! BILL IT WAS THE OTHER END !!! LOL
Good job guys! like I said earlier -just a matter of time before I see you guys in a bassboat beside me at 7:AM ! ready to blast off! talk soon Scott.
It was, as far as a I know, I've never gone that far up so it was all new to me. Worth the drive up the lake.
Great report guys!  Scott, the bass master....whoa, does that sound strange....LOL.  Great fish, great pics....looked like a great day...congrats guys.

WAS HOPIN FOR A 6AM START MARK BUT 7 WILL DO  LOL NO WHERE NEAR A BASS MASTER CLIFF. LOADS TO LEARN STILL. BUT WILL HELP FROM GUYS LIKE MARK AND TIME ON THE WATER IM WELL ON MY WAY !!! I HOPE  LOL LETS SEE IF I CAN REMATCH THAT SIX POUNDER THIS WEEKEND  LOL
Great Report. Looks like you are a fast learner and getting the hang of bass fishing! Some nice buckets there. Thanks for sharing.
Gotta like an outing like that, WTG...
